intro: Cyphostemma phyllomicron, commonly known as the small-leaf cyphostemma, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by small, spherical fruits. It is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
